intro: Aporosa stipulosa, commonly known as the hairy stipule plant, is a flowering plant species native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves with prominent stipules, which are leaf-like structures at the base of the petiole. Its small, white to pink flowers are typically arranged in clusters and bloom during the rainy season. Aporosa stipulosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
